Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the purpose of the 2-second rule?

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed

Question: What should you do when you are coming up to traffic signals and the signals change from green to yellow?

Answers.Answer: Stop at the signals if you can do so safely
Speed up before the light changes to red
Stop even if it means stopping in the middle of the intersection
Turn hard to the left and stop around the corner

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There has been a crash – slow down to 20km/h when passing this sign until you have passed the crash
There have been crashes here in the past – slow down
There has been a crash – but the road is clear now
This is an accident black spot

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
What is the minimum tread depth required for car tyres?
What should you do if an ambulance comes up behind you, flashing red lights or sounding its siren?

Answers.Answer: Put your vehicle hazard lights on and drive on at the same speed
Slow down, pull over and allow the ambulance to pass
Flash your vehicle headlights to warn oncoming traffic

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you have a restricted licence you can carry a passenger if they are your spouse.
What is the maximum distance a load may extend in front of a car?

Answers.Answer: 2 metres from the front edge of the front seat
3 metres from the front edge of the front seat
4 metres from the front edge of the front seat
5 metres from the front edge of the front seat

Question: What must you do when you see 2 red lights flashing outside a fire station?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and drive on carefully if the way is clear
Slow down and stop if any other vehicle is coming
Stop until the lights stop flashing

Question: If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: What does this road marking mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles displaying a mobility card may park here
You can park your wheelchair here
Wheelchair parking space for the next 30 metres

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When coming to a pedestrian crossing with a raised traffic island in the middle, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians who are on your half of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Remain stopped until the pedestrian has reached the other side of the road
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all on coming traffic

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
If you are driving at night with your vehicle headlights on high beam, when MUST you dip them?

Answers.Answer: Approaching a police officer on point duty

Question: At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: What does one or more yellow lights flashing at traffic signals mean?

Answers.Answer: Be careful and apply the give way rule
Drive on but increase your speed
Stop until the lights no longer flash
Move to the left-hand side of the road

Question: What does a blue reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road

Question: If you are turning left at an intersection, you must give way to vehicles coming towards you that are turning right.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When coming to a pedestrian crossing without a raised traffic island, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians on your side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on any part of the crossing
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all oncoming traffic

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely

Question: If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?
Which one of the following vehicles can you drive on a car licence?
What do these road markings mean?

Answers.Answer: Turning vehicles should enter turning lane at arrows and avoid striped area
Turning vehicles should avoid all road markings and use the left-hand lane
All vehicles can make a U-turn at these road markings
Turning vehicles drive straight over all road markings and wait to turn right

Question: What does the legal definition of a road include?
What is the meaning of a yellow broken line painted on the road near the kerb?

Answers.Answer: You may stop for no more than 5 minutes

Question: What must you do when turning right at a roundabout?

Answers.Answer: Not indicate at any time on the roundabout
Indicate left before entering the roundabout
Indicate right before entering the roundabout
Indicate right when leaving the roundabout
